title: Vintage Hand Tools
description: The trusty hand tools that built America's homes and fixed everything around the house

questions.question: What hand tool, featuring a curved claw on one end for pulling nails, was the most essential tool in any home toolbox?
What manual drilling tool, with a gear-driven mechanism operated by a rotating handle, was used before electric drills were affordable?
What woodworking hand tool was used to shave thin layers of wood to smooth and flatten a surface?
What tool, consisting of a retractable metal tape inside a case, replaced the folding wooden ruler for measuring?
What type of saw, with fine teeth and a thin blade held in a C-shaped frame, was used for cutting curves in wood?
What common tool with flat and Phillips head varieties was found in every household toolbox for driving screws?
What adjustable wrench, with a movable jaw operated by a thumbwheel, was sometimes called by a common brand name?
What level tool used a small glass vial containing liquid and an air bubble to determine if a surface was perfectly horizontal?
What folding ruler, made of hinged wooden segments, was commonly carried in a carpenter's apron pocket?
What hand tool with serrated jaws was used for gripping, bending, and cutting wire?
What type of handsaw, with a wide blade and large teeth, was the standard tool for cutting lumber by hand?
What weighted object, hung from a string, was used by builders to find a perfectly vertical line?
What Stanley product, introduced in the 1920s, became the most popular and recognizable brand of tape measure?
What tool, resembling a pointed punch, was used to make small holes in wood as a guide for screws?
What type of tool chest, often red and made of heavy steel, was a prized possession in many home workshops?
